review:
Beat the game. Pretty good game.

Got to be a 'movie star' and get my own car.

Overall, it's kinda hard to learn at the beginning (I hate the Temple of Trails), not like the modern Fallout games.

Then you start to get the hang of it. Then you find your first gun, then the real fun begins (unless you've tagged unarmed).

The story is pretty good. 

I think this might be my favorite Fallout game of all time. (FO4 being my 2nd fav)

10/10 game. Would recommend.

review:
It's a very good Fallout game in the series, the humour is very subjective depending on if you like references everywhere or not.  It's the first game to introduce the Enclave, and various other items along with characters that I don't want to spoil too much.

review: Це не просто гра - це досвід. Це приклад ідеального сиквелу до вже і так дуже хорошої гри. Це гра, приклад старої доброї RPG, у якій кількість варіантів проходження і їх методи просто лякають. Це гра, у якій ти задумуєшся "а так можна було?". Це гра просякнута атмосферою вже не постапокаліпсису, а постпостапокаліпсису, де люди змирилися з новим світом і стараються у ньому побудувати нове суспільство. Це усе Fallout 2. Це 12 розмовляючих анімованих 3D голів з 10

review:
Создал я значит перса. 10 в удачу - всё остальное по пятёркам. 
Взял особеность "Порченный" (дарова криты с пропуском своего хода или уроном по себе)
Починил машину у Смитти.
Доехал до Наварро и притворившись новичком, свистнул силовую броню Анклава.
"По пути" заглядываю на танкер в Сан-Франциско и с первого раза ворую гаус пушку у охранницы. (кража 15%)
Регулярно, стабильно наблюдал клоунаду, когда охранник каравана решетил с очереди своего нанимателя, вместо нападающих.
Вырезал в Нью-Рино несколько банд, а жену одного из главарей стабильно потряхивал. (в финале победили Райты. Пользуйтесь презиками пацаны.) 
Наконец заполучил ГЭКК, выполняя квесты (помог когтям смерти)
Приезжаю в деревню... "Ну и нахрен я это делал?"
Чиню Танкер. 
Доплываю до нефтевышки. Нахожу там второй ГЭКК "Ну и нахрен я это делал? - х2"
Убеждаю одного ботана газифицировать станцию. Подрываю кампудахтер пластидом.
На выходе убеждаю пареняг у входа, что именно тот амбал упал на Ребекку сверху.
Расстреливаем Абобуса.
ПРОФИТ.

И того 10 из 10 на момент релиза. (я тогда так ни разу и не проходил до конца)
7 из 10 на момент 25-го года. (произошло моральное устаревание подхода геймдизайна, который подразумевает, что игрок ознакомлен с руководством шедшим с этой игрой + вылеты ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ )

Олдфагам - советую. (но они и без меня уже там всё прошли)
Ньюфагам - не могу рекомендовать. Уж шибко изнеженное у вас поколение... Однако если вас не отталкивает "старость" игры - я только за. Дерзайте.
AUTONOMY SATISFACTION_QUOTE: Взял особеность Порченный (дарова криты с пропуском своего хода или уроном по себе)

review:
Played on Linux (Xubuntu 24.04)

Fallout 2 was quite entertaining. I almost liked it as much as the first game. The story and atmosphere are similar to Fallout 1 but not identical. You get the feeling that things in the world have progressed and in some cases regressed since the end of the Fallout 1 story.

The game in general has a few changes, additions and improvements over the first game. Companions were made a lot more helpful with some extra options to help control how they behave in combat. I liked the number and variety of side quests that were available. There are a couple UI improvements that make trading more convenient.

The combat difficulty has definitely been increased over the first game making character leveling and companions a lot more helpful. Shop items have been made more expensive so exploring and looting are more important.

I'm glad I decided to try the classic Fallout games before moving onto the newer ones.

I did experience some pretty heavy lag when entering some areas. Sometimes it was so bad, I just had to let the game sit idle for a while. It seems like a lot of people have been experiencing this issue.
AUTONOMY SATISFACTION_QUOTE: You get the feeling that things in the world have progressed and in some cases regressed since the end of the Fallout 1 story.

review: Распробовал только с 4 раза уже после пройденной первой части, 3, Нью Вегаса и 4 части. На голову ниже чем первая часть, хоть и дается больше возможностей. Взлом и кражу очень сильно понерфили, усилив тем самым F5-F9, и фрустрацию от этой механики. При этом сейвскамминг почти не увеличивает шансы на удачное действие. При этом в игре более сильный упор на прохождение ее сейвскаммингом. Есть машина, но дается слишком поздно, на уровне бонуса где можно выиграть жизнь после последнего босса в Chip & Dale. Чувствуется что игра очень сырая и делалась в попыхах. Храм испытаний - яркий пример плохого геймдизайна, возможно решение или подсказка были в гайде к игре или в мануале. Встречаются нелогичные решения ребусов. В этой части юмор смешнее чем в первой части. Багается квест с браминами: если убить всех скорпионов и двух чуваков - квест не сдается. Квест с псом, которого нужно спасти не сдался. Поменяли местами патроны для плазменного и ядерного оружия, я так понял в первой части допустили ошибку и плазменное оружие стреляло патронами для лазерного а лазерное от плазменного. Об этом надо было сказать во 2 части чтобы я не копил пол игры лазерные патроны к плазменному оружию. Очень много рандом энкаунтеров, по ощущениям, раза в 4 больше чем в первой части. Не нашел как лечить зависимость от наркотиков. Начал гуглить - нашел гайд и плюнул, решил играть с зависимостью. Зачем такие сложности. В 4 части зависимость лечится таблетками самостоятельно и для этого не надо читать гайды или заниматься пиксельхантингом. Вторичные навыки без первичных, прокачанных на 10 почти бесполезны, идея интересная, но мне больше понравилась прокачка в первой части. Игра хорошая, но перепроходить буду вряд ли.
COMPETENCE FRUSTRATION_QUOTE: Чувствуется что игра очень сырая и делалась в попыхах.
AUTONOMY FRUSTRATION_QUOTE: В этой части юмор смешнее чем в первой части.

review:
8/10
So a lot the issues I had with the first game is improved upon but overall the game feels very much the same to me as the first game but not in a bad way, Fallout 2 feels as if it should've been the first entry of the franchise and as you can see a lot of the assets from the first game are reused which makes sense considering Fallout 2 only came out a year later. The intro for this game hits harder for me considering ending of it sets the tone for the game pretty well and the pay off by the end of the game itself is very pleasing in my opinion.

Thoroughly enjoyed this game as much as Fallout 1, only real complaint is the movement on the grid this game seems to be restrained whereas in Fallout 1 you could be on one end of the map and point then click the other end to send MC that way, long as there isn't anything in their path that is, but in Fallout 2 it seems you're only allowed a specific number of tiles you can travel on the grid at a time which becomes annoying in bigger settlements/cities.

~ THE SCALE ~
0 - The devs belong on a watchlist.
1 - Pay me for playing this ♥♥♥♥!
2 - Uninstall immediately
3 - Is this even worth playing?
4 - Not memorable at all.
5 - Not good, not bad, it just exists.
6 - Some interesting elements.
7 - Pretty solid bones, could be better.
8 - Pretty fun game, might replay in the future.
9 - Worth several replays, it's that damn good.
10 - Endless replay value, it's one of a kind.
AUTONOMY FRUSTRATION_QUOTE: but in Fallout 2 it seems you're only allowed a specific number of tiles you can travel on the grid at a time which becomes annoying in bigger settlements/cities.

review:
There's some sort of issue with the World Map.  Everything runs correctly in the first town Arroyo, but as soon as you leave, the World Map freezes completely.  

I've done research on this - turns out it is a fairly common problem - something to do with the port to modern Windows.  No specific solution was found, other than recommendations to change some values in certain *.ini files -  none of those worked.

I've requested a refund.  What a bummer - it started off well, but now it's broken.

review: Still the most atmospheric, uncanny, hair-raising and oppressively depressive post apocalyptic rpg there is! Thanx to no small contribution by Mark Morgan, the ambiance set by this pivotal game is a sonic world unto its own. I've played and finished both Fo1 & 2 many times and now playing it after a few years of abstinence on et tu mods and tormenting difficulty choices still gives me a refreshing challenge. It's an 11/10 game whose narrative and world builing brilliance could only be matched by a select elite of other legendary crpgs like Planescape Torment or Arcanum. I'd be one jealous god to welcome to my kingdom the triumvirate of Cain, Boyarsky and Morgan one day. :)

review: Honestly is the best RPG of all time. Fantasy RPGs were bland and had boring combat. How did Fallouts 1 and 2 fix this? Set it in a Mad Max post apocalyptic setting and give the character rockets and miniguns instead of generic +4 wood bows and swords. Role-Playing is great but nothing can replace good combat and a serviceable story. There's a Van Buren mod in the works so if the base game doesn't grab you that will.

review:
War. War never changes.
The end of the world occurred pretty much as we had predicted. Too many humans, not enough space or resources to go around. The details are trivial and pointless, the reasons, as always, purely human ones.

The earth was nearly wiped clean of life. A great cleansing, an atomic spark struck by human hands, quickly raged out of control. Spears of nuclear fire rained from the skies. Continents were swallowed in flames and fell beneath the boiling oceans. Humanity was almost extinguished, their spirits becoming part of the background radiation that blanketed the earth.

A quiet darkness fell across the planet, lasting many years. Few survived the devastation. Some had been fortunate enough to reach safety, taking shelter in great underground vaults. When the great darkness passed, these vaults opened, and their inhabitants emerged to begin their lives again.

One of the northern tribes claims they are descended from one such Vault. They hold that their founder and ancestor, one known as the "Vault Dweller," once saved the world from a great evil. According to their legend, this evil arose in the far south. It corrupted all it touched, twisting men inside, turning them into beasts. Only through the bravery of this Vault Dweller was the evil destroyed. But in so doing, he lost many of his friends and suffered greatly, sacrificing much of himself to save the world.

When at last he returned to the home he had fought so hard to protect, he was cast out. Exiled. In confronting that which they feared, he had become something else in their eyes...and no longer their champion.

Forsaken by his people, he strode into the wasteland. He traveled far to the north, until he came to the great canyons. There, he founded a small village, Arroyo, where he lived out the rest of his years. And so, for a generation since its founding, Arroyo has lived in peace, its canyons sheltering it from the outside world. It is home. Your home.

But the scars left by the war have not yet healed. And the Earth has not forgotten.
